column4: Folks, I've been trying to install pdfedit and keep getting some errors related to libc6
I've tried three different installation methods (the recommended ones at the pdfedit page) and no dice
I ran sudo to install libc6 but it insistst that libc6 is already the newest version
are you compiling by any chance?
No, I just ran the the two recommended sudos, then wget to get the package
and then alien on on the rpm
it's probably an old package or just has the wrong info in it. alien isn't a good way to install packages
I've just been following the instructions here:
what seems to be common to all three methods on that page is that when I follow them, the installation craps out at the last stage
you may have to use the older package for now http://3v1n0.tuxfamily.org/pool/edgy/3v1n0/pdfedit_0.2.5-0+3v1ubuntu1_i386.deb
Thanks, OK, let me try that
when gutsy is out and you upgrade you'll get the newer package
Are there any other pdf editors out there that would work?
not sure, I never needed to edit a pdf, but I'm sure there's something in the repos
OK, thanks very much, I'll check things out a bit more
